author: David Maddock
title: Jurgen Klopp tells his young Liverpool side they must get cynically streetwise like Chelsea's table-toppers
text:
Jurgen Klopp faces the press ahead of Hull clash Share this video Watch Next 
“Being clever is part of football. 
“Chelsea are more experienced and sometimes more clever or smart, however you want to describe it. 
“Yes, we can improve on this but we cannot improve every day on everything.” 
Liverpool today visit Hull where their weaknesses will be fully tested by a side fighting for their lives at the foot of the table. 
It is games like this that Chelsea have taken so comfortably in their stride while Liverpool have struggled to get through them - in recent weeks they have drawn at home to West Ham and lost at home to Swansea, while also ­dropping two points at struggling Sunderland. Klopp is preparing for a clash against Hull (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) 
The German has been on the losing side on just one occasion against the rest of his top-six rivals in 15 attempts since his arrival midway through the 2015-16 season. But this season Liverpool have already lost to Burnley, Swansea, and Bournemouth. 
“We are working with human beings and things like that happen but for me the most important thing is that we know how to play them – now we have to show it all the time,” said Klopp. 
But the Kop boss admitted that it often comes down to game management and a slightly cynical approach – which allows teams like Conte’s to play on the edge of sportsmanship to get results. Klopp says he must be more like Conte in certain situations (Photo: Clive Mason) 
The German said: “We need more game management. Everyone talks about our intensity but sometimes when we run like devils I have to say ‘come on, please cool down,’ like Chelsea would do at 2-0 up or, when Conte was in Turin, 1-0 up. He would change things and put on an extra defender. That is a mentality. 
“Give us the time for this. There is a moment when you must think ‘let them come and we will counter-attack.’ 
“We have to develop a few things.” David Luiz netted the opener against Liverpool... (Photo: REUTERS) Before Gini Wijnaldum netted an equaliser (Photo: REUTERS) 
Klopp knows his players won’t acquire such ruthlessness overnight, and instead he wants them to concentrate on what they are good at – and what has made them so exciting this season.
